definition: to stir up public sentiment by false statements (idiom)/to resort to demagogy
arch. legendary venomous insect/to poison/to bewitch/to drive to insanity/to harm by witchcraft/intestinal parasite

sentences.english: We never thought of demagoguing the event.
sentences.chinese: 我们从未想过要拿此事件来蛊惑人心。

sentences.english: This is not reliably rabble-rousing stuff.
sentences.chinese: 这些并非是蛊惑人心的材料。

sentences.english: Not after all my mom has taught me to never surrender to the manipulative ways of advertising.
sentences.chinese: 我妈教我不要轻易相信广告蛊惑人心的办法。

sentences.english: You have to tear the elderly demagogic network.
sentences.chinese: 你得撕破老年的蛊惑人心的网。

definition: lit. dress up as God, play the devil (idiom); fig. to mystify/to deceive people/to scam
to mislead the public with rumors (idiom)/to delude the people with lies
deliberately mystifying/to make sth unnecessarily complicated
to damage the country and cause suffering to the people (idiom)
ignorant masses/to keep the people in ignorance
lit. to invert black and white (idiom); to distort the truth deliberately/to misrepresent the facts/to invert right and wrong
to be glib in one's speech and wear an ingratiating expression (idiom)
